issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Responses from the auto scaling service use the back-end identifier which has a different format from the actual response identifier:

{code}
<DescribeScalingActivitiesResponse xmlns="http://autoscaling.amazonaws.com/doc/2011-01-01/">
  <DescribeScalingActivitiesResult>
    <Activities/>
  </DescribeScalingActivitiesResult>
  <ResponseMetadata>
    <RequestId>7189a68d-2e0f-411c-a80c-ac4d72c3d2ce::34f024d7-2e10-4d4e-9902-164068de804d</RequestId>
  </ResponseMetadata>
</DescribeScalingActivitiesResponse>
{code}

The request id should be the GUID of the front-end request message.
fields.summary: Auto scaling response messages use back-end message identifier

comments.body:
Hi,

Please guide me how to verify this bug fix.

Thanks,
Kasim Shaik.

[~kshaik], to verify the fix consume the autoscaling service with debug output enabled:

{code}
#
# euscale-describe-adjustment-types --debug
2015-01-06 09:20:11,468 DEBUG   DescribeAdjustmentTypes parsed arguments: {'security_token': None, 'url': None, 'region': None, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None}
2015-01-06 09:20:11,468 INFO    Config finding global option default-region
2015-01-06 09:20:11,468 INFO    Config   novalue for default-region
2015-01-06 09:20:11,468 INFO    Config finding global option max-retries
2015-01-06 09:20:11,468 INFO    Config   novalue for max-retries
2015-01-06 09:20:11,468 INFO    Config finding global option timeout
2015-01-06 09:20:11,468 INFO    Config   novalue for timeout
2015-01-06 09:20:11,471 INFO    DescribeAdjustmentTypes parameters: {'Action': 'DescribeAdjustmentTypes', 'Version': '2011-01-01'}
2015-01-06 09:20:11,472 INFO    AutoScaling sending request (attempt 1 of 3)
2015-01-06 09:20:11,473 DEBUG   QuerySigV2Auth string to sign: 'POST\n10.111.1.69:8773\n/services/AutoScaling\nAWSAccessKeyId=AKIFUYOFT22VGPN1XMSH&Action=DescribeAdjustmentTypes&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2015-01-06T17%3A20%3A11Z&Version=2011-01-01'
2015-01-06 09:20:11,473 DEBUG   QuerySigV2Auth b64-encoded signature: B6o33yDjFN3QKMS2nw5MmMPO4Vhq1UzevhSKLmX5IvI=
2015-01-06 09:20:11,473 DEBUG   QuerySigV2Auth converting params to POST data
2015-01-06 09:20:11,479 DEBUG   AutoScaling request method: POST
2015-01-06 09:20:11,479 DEBUG   AutoScaling request url:    http://10.111.1.69:8773/services/AutoScaling
2015-01-06 09:20:11,479 DEBUG   AutoScaling request header: Content-Length: 223
2015-01-06 09:20:11,479 DEBUG   AutoScaling request header: Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
2015-01-06 09:20:11,479 DEBUG   AutoScaling request header: Host: 10.111.1.69:8773
2015-01-06 09:20:11,479 DEBUG   AutoScaling request header: User-Agent: euca2ools/3.1.0-2-g825506e (CPython 2.6.6; Linux 2.6.32-504.3.3.el6.x86_64; x86_64) requestbuilder/0.2.1 requests/1.1.0
2015-01-06 09:20:11,480 DEBUG   AutoScaling request data:   AWSAccessKeyId: AKIFUYOFT22VGPN1XMSH
2015-01-06 09:20:11,480 DEBUG   AutoScaling request data:   Action: DescribeAdjustmentTypes
2015-01-06 09:20:11,480 DEBUG   AutoScaling request data:   Signature: B6o33yDjFN3QKMS2nw5MmMPO4Vhq1UzevhSKLmX5IvI=
2015-01-06 09:20:11,480 DEBUG   AutoScaling request data:   SignatureMethod: HmacSHA256
2015-01-06 09:20:11,480 DEBUG   AutoScaling request data:   SignatureVersion: 2
2015-01-06 09:20:11,480 DEBUG   AutoScaling request data:   Timestamp: 2015-01-06T17:20:11Z
2015-01-06 09:20:11,480 DEBUG   AutoScaling request data:   Version: 2011-01-01
2015-01-06 09:20:11,527 DEBUG   AutoScaling response time: 0.046 seconds
2015-01-06 09:20:11,527 INFO    AutoScaling response status: 200
2015-01-06 09:20:11,527 DEBUG   AutoScaling response header: content-length: 520
2015-01-06 09:20:11,527 DEBUG   AutoScaling response header: content-type: application/xml; charset=UTF-8
2015-01-06 09:20:11,527 DEBUG   DescribeAdjustmentTypes -- response content --
<DescribeAdjustmentTypesResponse xmlns="http://autoscaling.amazonaws.com/doc/2011-01-01/"><DescribeAdjustmentTypesResult><AdjustmentTypes><member><AdjustmentType>ChangeInCapacity</AdjustmentType></member><member><AdjustmentType>ExactCapacity</AdjustmentType></member><member><AdjustmentType>PercentChangeInCapacity</AdjustmentType></member></AdjustmentTypes></DescribeAdjustmentTypesResult><ResponseMetadata><RequestId>9bc9d3ea-c768-4a0b-924e-77dc8c796ce8</RequestId></ResponseMetadata></DescribeAdjustmentTypesResponse>
2015-01-06 09:20:11,528 DEBUG   DescribeAdjustmentTypes -- end of response content --
ADJUSTMENT-TYPE	ChangeInCapacity
ADJUSTMENT-TYPE	ExactCapacity
ADJUSTMENT-TYPE	PercentChangeInCapacity
#
#
{code}

and verify that the request identifier is in the expected format ("9bc9d3ea-c768-4a0b-924e-77dc8c796ce8" in the above example) rather than the back-end format which contains ":", e.g. "7189a68d-2e0f-411c-a80c-ac4d72c3d2ce::34f024d7-2e10-4d4e-9902-164068de804d"

Hi,

The output of "euscale-describe-adjustment-types --debug"  command shown below.

The format of Request ID is in the expected format (e38ae42 f-a162-4fd5-a7e8-c3ac1ec39b94) as stated in steve's earlier comment.

[root@h-12 test]# euscale-describe-adjustment-types --debug
2015-01-07 03:24:02,013 DEBUG   DescribeAdjustmentTypes parsed arguments: {'security_token': None, 'url': None, 'region': None, 'show_empty_fi elds': False, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None}

<DescribeAdjustmentTypesResponse xmlns="http://autoscaling.amazonaws.com/doc/2011-01-01/"><DescribeAdjustmentTypesResult><AdjustmentTypes><mem ber><AdjustmentType>ChangeInCapacity</AdjustmentType></member><member><AdjustmentType>ExactCapacity</AdjustmentType></member><member><Adjustme ntType>PercentChangeInCapacity</AdjustmentType></member></AdjustmentTypes></DescribeAdjustmentTypesResult><ResponseMetadata><RequestId>e38ae42 f-a162-4fd5-a7e8-c3ac1ec39b94</RequestId></ResponseMetadata></DescribeAdjustmentTypesResponse>

Therefore, this bug is fixed and verified in 4.1 build.

Thanks,
Kasim Shaik.
Fix verified per last comment from [~kshaik]
